titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Dick Thornburgh Papers, 1932- AIS.1998.30.18
titlestmt.subtitle: Series XVIII. Photographs, 1932-2004
titlestmt.author: Nancy Watson
titlestmt.sponsor: This finding aid is available on line as result of a Commonwealth of Pennsylvania grant to the University of Pittsburgh and with collaboration of the Archives Service Center and the Digital Research Library.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 09:28:01 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Dick Thornburgh Papers, Series XVIII. Photographs
did.abstract: The Dick Thornburgh collection consists of 6000 photographs, approximately 500 of which are available online. Some are black and white, some color, and sizes vary. There are some photos by professionals and Pennsylvania's Commonwealth Media staff. Other snapshots are of a more informal nature, provided by event attendees and friends as well as by staff. The photographs date from Thornburgh's early childhood and continue into 2004. Many are from Thornburgh's two terms as Governor of Pennsylvania, and his years as Attorney General of the United States. Others are from his campaigns for U.S. Congress in 1966, his two gubernatorial campaigns in 1978 and 1982, and his campaign for U.S. Senate in 1991. Some are from events, others from foreign trips from his years as Governor, Attorney General, and his ongoing career. They are colorful, representative of a broad array of events and topics. Digital reproductions of portions of the collection are available online.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Dick Thornburgh Papers, 1932- , AIS.1998.30, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Dick Thornburgh Papers, 1932- , AIS.1998.30, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Nancy Watson, Curator of the Thornburgh Papers, Holly Mengel, Project Archivist, and a team of graduate students. Processing was made possible by a grant from the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania in 2002.

Revision and rearrangement for the encoded version of the finding aid provided by Holly Mengel in 2004. Information about the collection title and the controlled access terms was extracted from the MARC record in the University of Pittsburgh catalog Voyager ID number: 3608599

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Permission for publication is given on behalf of the University of Pittsburgh as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission of the copyright holder, which must also be obtained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Dick Thornburgh archive includes 6,000 photographs. Some are black and white, some color, and sizes vary. There are some photos by professionals and Commonwealth Media staff. There are other snapshots of a more informal nature, provided by event attendees and friends as well as by staff. The photographs date from Thornburgh's early childhood and schooling and continue into 2004, during his ongoing career. Many are from Thornburgh's two terms as Governor of Pennsylvania, and his years Attorney General of the United States. Others are from his campaigns for U.S. Congress in 1966, his two gubernatorial campaigns in 1978 and 1982, and his campaign for U.S. Senate in 1991. Some are from events, others are from trips abroad during his years as Governor, Attorney General, and his ongoing career. They are colorful, representative of a broad array of events and topics, and pictorially interesting.
A major group of approximately 500 photographs for which we have ownership and/or permission have been digitized, are available here online, and are searchable.
